conversation.message: Dear School_D admissions team, I’m Student_C and I’m formally applying to School_D as my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your program and would gladly commit if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. However, School_D’s priority list ranks me 2nd (after Student_A), and Student_A ranks School_D only 3rd, so there is a reasonable chance Student_A applies elsewhere first. To maximize my chance at my #1, I should apply immediately and signal strong commitment. If accepted, I lock in my best outcome; if rejected, I can pivot to School_C next round.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for ranking School_D as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_D. Welcome—please confirm your intent to enroll and we’ll share the next steps for enrollment and orientation.
conversation.thought: Student_C is #2 on School_D’s true priority list (behind Student_A). In this round, only Student_C applied to us, and Student_C ranks School_D as their #1 choice, so acceptance is very likely to lock in a stable match. Holding out for Student_A is risky because Student_A prefers School_E and School_B over School_D, and may never apply here. With quota 1, accepting Student_C now secures a high-priority match rather than gambling for the top choice.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_D. School_E is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community. I’m ready to commit and would be grateful to be considered for your available seat; if you’re weighing candidates, I’d appreciate being kept in consideration in case higher-priority students choose other options. Thank you for your time.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E. Although School_E’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_A), applying immediately is still optimal because any chance at my top option is worth taking early, and delaying could only reduce my odds if higher-priority students apply first. I will signal strong interest and fit, and ask to be considered if higher-priority candidates go elsewhere.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_E. At this time, we’re unable to offer you admission for our available seat. We truly appreciate you reaching out, and we wish you the very best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and received APPLY from Students B, A, and D. On School_E true priority list: E > B > A > D > C. Student_D is 4th, while B and A are higher and also rank School_E as their first choice, making them likely to commit if accepted. To maximize chance of matching with highest-priority student, reject D now and preserve capacity for B (or A) this round. Student_E (top priority) does not appear in inbox and ranks School_E last, so unlikely to apply later; best available is B, then A. Thus reject D.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions, I’m Student_A. School_E is my first-choice school, and if admitted I will enthusiastically accept and commit. I’m excited by the opportunity to join your community and contribute positively both academically and through school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_E, so I should apply immediately. Although School_E ranks me 3rd (behind Student_E and Student_B) and several other students also prefer School_E, applying now maximizes my chance if higher-priority students go elsewhere or are rejected. I will clearly express School_E is my first choice and that I would commit if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you very much for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_E. After reviewing applications for our available seat this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We truly appreciate your enthusiasm for School_E, and we wish you the very best in your other applications.
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and received APPLYs from Student_D, Student_A, and Student_B. On School_E’s true priority list: Student_B is ranked #2, Student_A is #3, Student_D is #4. Since Student_B is higher priority than Student_A and has applied this round, accepting Student_A now would block a better match. Therefore, reject Student_A to preserve the seat for Student_B (or potentially Student_E if they apply later).

conversation.message: Hello School_E. You are my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I’m very excited about the chance to join your community and contribute academically and positively. If admitted, I will commit fully and make School_E my top destination. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E. I have strong priority there (2nd overall), so an early application maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before competition settles elsewhere.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_E as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_E. If you confirm, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and received APPLY from Students D, A, and B this round. School_E true priority is E > B > A > D > C. Among current applicants, Student_B is the highest-ranked. Although Student_E is ranked above B, Student_E’s preferences place School_E last, so it is very unlikely they will apply here. Accepting Student_B now secures a high-priority match and ends risk of losing the seat to a lower-ranked student later.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions Committee. I’m Student_E, and School_C is my first-choice school. I’m very eager to join your community and would like to formally apply for your available seat. If accepted, I will commit to enrolling at School_C. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, so I should pursue it immediately. Although School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th, I can still have a chance if higher-priority students apply elsewhere (Student_B and Student_A both rank School_E first; Student_D ranks School_E first; Student_C ranks School_D first). Since many competitors may not target School_C in round 1, applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before the seat is taken.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your strong interest in School_C and for submitting your application. After reviewing our priorities for this cycle and given our limited remaining seat, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your commitment and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list but ranked 4th (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D). In round 1, higher-priority students are likely to apply elsewhere first: Student_B prefers School_E then School_C (so may come to us if not accepted by School_E), Student_A ranks us last, Student_D ranks us last, Student_C ranks us 2nd but is not on our priority list. Since we have quota 1, accepting Student_E now could block a potential later application from higher-priority Student_B. Given Student_E will commit, but our objective is to match as high as possible on our list, it is strategically better to reject now and keep capacity for Student_B in subsequent rounds.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_D. After reflecting on my fit, School_A is my top remaining choice, and I’m applying for your available seat. I’m excited about the academic environment and would be ready to accept and commit immediately if offered admission. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_E already rejected me. Among remaining unmatched schools (A, B, C), School_A is my true #2 choice and I also have strong priority there (2nd in School_A’s ranking). Applying now maximizes my chance of securing a high-preference match before the seat is taken by a higher-priority applicant (Student_B). I will signal strong commitment and readiness to accept immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A, contingent on your commitment to enroll.

We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority order is B > D > A > C > E. In this round, Student_D and Student_E applied. D is ranked 2nd, E is ranked 5th, so D strictly dominates E for our objective. Although Student_B is our top choice, they have School_A last in their preferences and are likely to match elsewhere, making waiting risky. Accepting Student_D now secures a very high-priority match and uses our single seat efficiently.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions Committee,

My name is Student_E. After careful consideration, I’m very excited about the academic environment and community at School_A, and I would like to formally apply for your available seat. If admitted, I will commit to enrolling at School_A.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: School_C already rejected me, so my best remaining option is my next-highest true preference among unmatched schools: School_A. Although I am low in School_A’s priority list, it’s still preferable to applying to lower-ranked choices. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and willingness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. At this time, we no longer have an available seat, so we are unable to offer you admission.

We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in your remaining admissions process.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 0 and are already matched with Student_D from last round. Rules require rejecting any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Even if we could reconsider, Student_D is 2nd on our true priority list and Student_E is last, so we would not displace Student_D for Student_E. Therefore, reject Student_E while being polite and possibly encouraging them to pursue other schools.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_A, and I’m writing to formally apply. School_B is one of my top choices, and if admitted I will accept immediately and commit. I’m excited about the chance to contribute to School_B’s academic community and take part in school activities.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_A
conversation.thought: School_B is my true second choice among the remaining unmatched schools. I also have top priority at School_B (they rank Student_A first), so an [APPLY] should secure an immediate match if the seat is still open. This maximizes my outcome after being rejected by School_E.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. We are pleased to offer you admission.

We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_A is #1 on School_B’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and no current match. Accepting Student_A immediately secures our top choice and prevents losing them to other schools (Student_A ranks School_E first and could match there if we delay). No higher-priority candidate exists, so accepting is optimal.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

Thank you again for considering my earlier application. I noticed School_C still appears to have an open seat, and I would like to respectfully reaffirm my strong interest and formally apply again. School_C remains my first choice, and if admitted I will commit to enrolling immediately.

If there is any updated information you need from me to support reconsideration, I’m happy to provide it.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. I already applied and was rejected, likely due to their priority order and competition, but since they are still unmatched there may be renewed flexibility or the previously preferred candidate matched elsewhere. I will send a concise, respectful re-application reaffirming commitment and asking to be reconsidered if a seat is available.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_C and for reaffirming your commitment. After reviewing our priority order for this cycle and considering our limited capacity, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your persistence and wish you the best in the remainder of the matching process.
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list is B > A > D > E > C. Student_E is 4th, acceptable but not ideal. I still have quota 1 and no other applicants this round, but higher-priority students (B, A, D) may approach later as they get rejected from their top choices. Student_B ranks School_C 2nd (after School_E), Student_A ranks School_C last, Student_D ranks School_C last, so B is the most plausible high-priority future applicant. Holding the seat open preserves the chance to match with B (or possibly A/D if their options collapse). Since I prefer leaving the seat unfilled over taking someone outside the list (not relevant here) and E is not my top choice, I should reject again to keep flexibility.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

Thank you for your time throughout this process. I understand your priority constraints, but since School_C is still available, I would like to submit a final formal application for the remaining seat.

School_C is my clear first choice, and if admitted I will commit to enrolling immediately and withdraw from all other options. If there is any specific information you need from me to confirm my commitment or eligibility, I can provide it right away.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Although I have been rejected twice, School_C may still be holding the seat while waiting for higher-priority students to match elsewhere. A direct [APPLY] could trigger an acceptance if higher-priority candidates are no longer available; I will reaffirm my binding commitment and ask if any condition would change their decision.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for clearly stating your commitment to School_C. We have reviewed your application again, and we are pleased to offer you admission.

Please confirm that you will enroll at School_C and withdraw from other options as stated.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list but ranks below Student_B, Student_A, and Student_D. Our quota is 1 and still unfilled. Student_B ranks School_C as 2nd (after School_E) and may come to us if rejected by School_E; Student_A ranks us last and is unlikely; Student_D ranks us last and is unlikely; Student_C ranks us 2nd but is not on our priority list (we prefer empty over them). Given Student_E has already applied multiple times with a firm commitment and we currently have no higher-priority applicant in our inbox, accepting now secures a preferred (acceptable) match rather than risking ending unmatched if higher-priority students never approach us. Therefore accept Student_E.
